history.content:
This is my opinion and may not directly correlate to you.

I think it will be tough. 61c is usually a similar load to 61b, 170 hws take longer than 70's, and 16B is overall a lot more demanding than 16A (haven't taken it, just from word of mouth and from looking at the topics). I think it's definitely possible with good time management and no other heavy classes.

children.subject: Definitely agree that both 16 classes should be manageable conceptually with the mathematical maturity of completing CS70. A lot of students spend overall more time in 16B because the concepts introduced aren't concepts that a majority of students have already been exposed to (mostly targeted at the linear algebra components of 16A).

+1 that 16B homeworks were not as long as 16A homeworks.
Also +1 the final lab project takes up extra time

In my opinion 16B is more chill than 16A.  The homework is shorter and I think easier, the labs are more guided and straightforward (Only thing you might spend a little extra time at the end of semester working on the car project for 16B).  Both classes are manageable conceptually.

history.content:
Has any student taken CS61C, CS170, and EE16B together in one semester? How was the workload and is it manageable? 

For reference I took CS70 and CS61B together last semester and did well in both. They did suck up a lot of my free time though. I'm currently taking EE16A over the summer and so far it hasn't been too bad since I've had a lot of linear algebra experience.

Thanks!
history.subject: Course difficulty CS61C, CS170, EE16B
